    • testSolveSPDDoesntSpoilTheVector

      @Test @DisplayName("solveSPD(double[]) does not spoil the passed vector") void testSolveSPDDoesntSpoilTheVector()

    • testSolveSPDAccuratelyIsAccurate

      @Test @DisplayName("solveSPDAccurately(double[]) returns a much more accurate solution than solveSPD()") void testSolveSPDAccuratelyIsAccurate()
      Generates a series of random matrices (data samples), solves the corresponding systems of linear equations, and estimates the minimum and average ratio of accuracy improvement achieved by the DoubleMatrix.solveAccurately(double[]) compared with the DoubleMatrix.solve(double[]). Asserts that the minimum improvement ratio is greater that EXPECTED_MIN_IMPROVEMENT and the average improvement ratio is greater than EXPECTED_AVR_IMPROVEMENT
      See Also:
      • EXPECTED_MIN_IMPROVEMENT

    • testRepeatedSolveSPDReturnsCorrectSolution

      @Test @DisplayName("another call to solveSPD(double[]) with another vector also returns a correct solution") void testRepeatedSolveSPDReturnsCorrectSolution()

    • testSolveSPDWithWrongVectorLengthThrowsException

      @Test @DisplayName("solveSPD(double[]) with wrong vector length throws IllegalArgumentException containing \'must have the same size\'") void testSolveSPDWithWrongVectorLengthThrowsException()

    • testSolveSPDWithNonPdMatrixThrowsException

      @Test @DisplayName("solveSPD(double[]) with non-positively-defined matrix throws IllegalArgumentException containing \'must be positively defined\'") void testSolveSPDWithNonPdMatrixThrowsException()

    • testSolveSPDWithAsymmetricMatrixThrowsException
